p: Myelitis implies that inflammation of the spinal cord parenchyma is present, usually in the anterior horn cell [ 4]. The viruses implicated are enteroviruses, arboviruses, HSV-1, VZV, poliovirus and coxsackie virus-A and B. If both the brain parenchyma and the spinal cord are affected it is called encephalomyelitis [ 4]. Patients present with acute flaccid paralysis.
